name: 8.19 "Indoor Fun with Sammy and Robby" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Carla say Robin was in charge of?
questions.explanation:
Debriefing Jean-Marie.

	Jean-Marie was Robin's other girlfriend. She was the one who was getting all the attention by the media.

questions.text: What wouldn't Cliff's mom allow in the house?
questions.explanation:
Puberty.

	Cliff was explaining how puberty was a very difficult time for him. Norm asked him why and he replied, "Ma wouldn't allow it in the house."

questions.text: What was Rebecca's nickname for Robin?
questions.explanation:
Sweet baby.

	Robin didn't have a nickname for Rebecca. Rebecca had a whole day planned with Robin.

questions.text: Why did Robin say he snapped?
questions.correct: The business of sitting all day doing nothing gets on his nerves.
options: The day Rebecca had planned was boring.
The Patriots didn't win the Superbowl that year.
The gang at Cheers were mean to him.
questions.explanation:
The business of sitting all day doing nothing gets on his nerves.

	He tells them at first that it wasn't "you people". Then he explains why he snapped and then said "Maybe it is you people". Robin was a very busy man and could not comprehend how people just sat around all day.

questions.text: Who was the best dart player in the bar?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam needed a bull's eye to win and he did it with total ease. Darts was the first game he played with Robin.

questions.text: Who did Rebecca bury up to his neck in the sand?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Since Robin was playing games with Sam, Rebecca took Woody to the beach. She forgot until she was at Cheers that she buried him, so she ran out to unbury him.

questions.text: How much did Robin bet Sam on a game of pool?
questions.explanation:
$1.

	Everyone was cheering for Sam. At first Sam didn't think it was worth betting just one lousy dollar. Robin explained that it was a trophy of sorts.

questions.text: Who won the pool game: Sam or Robin?
questions.explanation:
Sam & Samuel.

	Sam asked them which president Washington was (because he's on the $1 bill) and they all yelled "Number one, number one!". Robin said that Sam could beat him at games like darts and pool because they didn't involve thinking.

questions.text: Who got hit in the head with a pool ball?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	Cliff said he was okay. However, he kept repeating himself over and over, so he was taken to the hospital to get checked out.

questions.text: What game did Sam cheat at?
questions.explanation:
Chess.

	He had headphones on and pretended to be listening to a ball game. Robin figured out he was cheating because the ball game he was listening to ended over an hour ago. The cheating equipment died however, and Sam still won the game. They bet a weeks salary. Robin explained how he paid himself only $1 a week and after taxes and everything else that was taken out he made 1 penny. Rebecca was angry that her day was ruined over one penny.
